subject: AI & Agents
title: ROI of AI Features: Justifying the Investment
description: A short lesson to help you apply ROI of AI Features: Justifying the Investment.

hook.text: The AI feature cost $200K to build. The CEO asks: 'What's the return?'

buildup.text: AI ROI is hard to measure because benefits are indirect: time saved, churn reduced, support deflected.

discovery.text: Build a business case: cost of current process vs cost with AI, including development and maintenance.

twist.text: The biggest ROI often isn't revenueâ€”it's reduced manual work or prevented errors.

climax.text: Track leading indicators (usage, time saved) and lagging indicators (revenue, retention) separately.

punchline.text: Measure what matters. Not every return is in dollars.

quiz.question: Why is AI ROI hard to measure?
options: Benefits are often indirect like time saved or errors prevented
AI always has clear revenue impact
